text: Treviso is a comune and city in the Veneto region, in Northeast Italy. Treviso is the capital of the province of the same name. The city is about north of Venice, the capital of the region. ==Geography== Treviso is at the confluence of the Botteniga and Sile rivers, north of Venice, east of Vicenza, north-east of Padua, and south of Cortina d'Ampezzo. The city is at about southwest the right bank of the Piave river, on the plain between the Gulf of Venice (Adriatic Sea) and the Alps. The comune of Treviso has an area of and its altitude is . Treviso borders with the following comuniː Carbonera, Casier, Paese, Ponzano Veneto, Preganziol, Quinto di Treviso, Silea, Villorba, Zero Branco. === Climate === The climate of Treviso is an oceanic climate with template summers, Cfb (Marine West Coast Climate) in the Köppen climate classification. The average temperature for the year in Treviso is . The warmest month, on average, is July with an average temperature of . The coolest month on average is January, with an average temperature of . The average amount of precipitation for the year in Treviso is . The month with the most precipitation on average is June with of precipitation. The month with the least precipitation on average is February with an average of . ==Population== , there are 83,731 persons living in the comune, for a population density of inhabitants/km².
